concise_definition: v. 切, 剪, 切断; n. 切口, 切法, 剪裁

definitions.explanation_en: To divide or separate something with a sharp instrument, such as a knife, scissors, or blade.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用刀、剪刀或刀片等锋利工具将某物切开或分离。
definitions.example_en: She cut the bread with a sharp knife.
definitions.example_cn: 她用一把锋利的刀切开了面包。

definitions.explanation_en: To reduce or remove something, especially in quantity, cost, or content, often to improve efficiency or save resources.
definitions.explanation_cn: 减少或移除某物，尤其指数量、成本或内容，通常为了提高效率或节约资源。
definitions.example_en: The company decided to cut its budget by 20% this year.
definitions.example_cn: 公司今年决定将预算削减20%。

definitions.explanation_en: To stop or interrupt a signal, connection, or activity suddenly.
definitions.explanation_cn: 突然中断信号、连接或活动。
definitions.example_en: The phone call was cut off due to poor reception.
definitions.example_cn: 由于信号不好，电话被切断了。

definitions.explanation_en: To edit or remove parts of a film, video, or text to shorten or improve it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过删减部分影像、视频或文本以缩短或优化内容。
definitions.example_en: The director cut five minutes from the final scene to tighten the pacing.
definitions.example_cn: 导演删掉了最后一场五分种的镜头，以加快节奏。

definitions.explanation_en: A style or method of cutting hair, clothing, or other materials, often referring to a fashionable design.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指头发、衣物或其他材料的剪裁方式，常指时尚的设计样式。
definitions.example_en: He got a new cut for the summer — short on the sides, longer on top.
definitions.example_cn: 他夏天换了新发型：两侧短，顶部留长。

definitions.explanation_en: A portion or serving of food, especially meat, that has been sliced or prepared for eating.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一块已切好或准备食用的食物，尤指肉类。
definitions.example_en: The restaurant serves a perfect cut of ribeye steak.
definitions.example_cn: 这家餐厅提供一块完美的肋眼牛排。

comparison.analysis: “Chop” (剁) 通常指用重力或猛力将物体砍断，动作更粗暴、不精确，常用于处理骨头或硬质食材，如“chop vegetables”；而 “cut” 更通用，可指精细或轻柔的切割动作，适用范围更广。
“Slice” (切片) 特指将物体切成薄片，强调形状和厚度的均匀性，常用于食物（如切面包、奶酪）；而 “cut” 是更宽泛的动词，可包含切片、切断、剪断等多种方式，不特指薄片。
“Trim” (修剪) 指轻微地剪去多余或不整齐的部分，以改善外观或功能，如修剪草坪、指甲或头发边缘；而 “cut” 可以是大幅度的分离，不一定是为了修饰，可能涉及移除大量部分。
